qas.question: What is one type of pesticide?
How long may it take for persistent pesticides to be broken down?
What quality caused DDT to build up in various organisms?
What is one way to classify pesticides?
What is one characteristic that defines the nature of microbes?
How long do microbes live in the soil?

plausible_answers.text: the type of pest they control

qas.question: What is one way to classify birds?
What happens when there are too many microbes in the soil?
Where do microbes usually come from when in the environment?

context: Pesticides are often referred to according to <b6_0>the <a3_0>type of pest they control<b6_0/><a3_0/>. Pesticides can also be considered as either <a0_0>biodegradable<a0_0/> pesticides, which will be broken down by microbes and other living beings into harmless compounds, or <b4_0>persistent<b4_0/> pesticides, which may take <a1_0><b5_0>months or years<b5_0/><a1_0/> before they are broken down: it was the <a2_0>persistence<a2_0/> of DDT, for example, which led to its accumulation in the food chain and its <b7_0>killing of birds of prey<b7_0/> at the top of the food chain. Another way to think about pesticides is to consider those that are chemical pesticides or are derived from <b8_0>a common source<b8_0/> or production method.
